reactor.rx

Class Promise<O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.rx.Promise<O>
  • Type Parameters:
    O - the type of the value that will be made available
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.reactivestreams.Processor<O,O>, org.reactivestreams.Publisher<O>, org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<O>, NonBlocking, Consumer<O>, Supplier<O>

    public class Promise<O>
extends Object
implements Supplier<O>, org.reactivestreams.Processor<O,O>, Consumer<O>, NonBlocking
    A Promise is a stateful event container that accepts a single value or error. In addition to getting or awaiting the value, consumers can be registered to the outbound stream() or via , consumers can be registered to be notified of notified an error, a value, or both.

    A promise also provides methods for composing actions with the future value much like a Stream. However, where a Stream can process many values, a Promise processes only one value or error.

    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini
    See Also:
    Promises/A+ specification

      • subscription

        protected org.reactivestreams.Subscription subscription

    • Constructor Detail

      • Promise

        public Promise()
        Creates a new unfulfilled promise.

        The dispatcher is used when notifying the Promise's consumers, determining the thread on which they are called. The given env is used to determine the default await timeout. The default await timeout will be 30 seconds. This Promise will consumer errors from its parent such that if the parent completes in error then so too will this Promise.

      • Promise

        public Promise(Dispatcher dispatcher,
               @Nullable
               Environment env)
        Creates a new unfulfilled promise.

        The dispatcher is used when notifying the Promise's consumers, determining the thread on which they are called. The given env is used to determine the default await timeout. If env is null the default await timeout will be 30 seconds. This Promise will consumer errors from its parent such that if the parent completes in error then so too will this Promise.

        Parameters:
        dispatcher - The Dispatcher to run any downstream subscribers
        env - The Environment, if any, from which the default await timeout is obtained

      • Promise

        public Promise(O value,
               Dispatcher dispatcher,
               @Nullable
               Environment env)
        Creates a new promise that has been fulfilled with the given value.

        The observable is used when notifying the Promise's consumers. The given env is used to determine the default await timeout. If env is null the default await timeout will be 30 seconds.

        Parameters:
        value - The value that fulfills the promise
        dispatcher - The Dispatcher to run any downstream subscribers
        env - The Environment, if any, from which the default await timeout is obtained

      • Promise

        public Promise(Throwable error,
               Dispatcher dispatcher,
               @Nullable
               Environment env)
        Creates a new promise that has failed with the given error.

        The observable is used when notifying the Promise's consumers, determining the thread on which they are called. The given env is used to determine the default await timeout. If env is null the default await timeout will be 30 seconds.

        Parameters:
        error - The error the completed the promise
        dispatcher - The Dispatcher to run any downstream subscribers
        env - The Environment, if any, from which the default await timeout is obtained

      • flatMap

        public <V> Promise<V> flatMap(@Nonnull
                              Function<? super O,? extends org.reactivestreams.Publisher<? extends V>> transformation)
        Assign a Function that will either be invoked later, when the Promise is successfully completed with a value, or, if this Promise has already been fulfilled, is immediately scheduled to be executed on the current Dispatcher.

        FlatMap is typically used to listen for a delayed/async publisher, e.g. promise.flatMap( data -> Promise.success (data) ). The result is merged directly on the returned stream.

        Parameters:
        transformation - the function to apply on signal to the supplied Promise that will be merged back.
        Returns:
        the new Promise

      • onError

        public Promise<O> onError(@Nonnull
                          Consumer<Throwable> onError)
        Assign a Consumer that will either be invoked later, when the Promise is completed with an error, or, if this Promise has already been fulfilled, is immediately scheduled to be executed on the current Dispatcher. The error is recovered and materialized as the next signal to the returned stream.
        Parameters:
        onError - the error Consumer
        Returns:
        the new Promise

        public boolean isComplete()
        Indicates whether this Promise has been completed with either an error or a value

        Returns:

      • awaitSuccess

        public boolean awaitSuccess()
                     throws InterruptedException
        Block the calling thread, waiting for the completion of this Promise. A default timeout as specified in Reactor's Environment properties using the key reactor.await.defaultTimeout is used. The default is 30 seconds. If the promise is completed with an error a RuntimeException that wraps the error is thrown.
        Returns:
        true if complete without error
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interruped while awaiting completion
        RuntimeException - if the promise is completed with an error

      • awaitSuccess

        public boolean awaitSuccess(long timeout,
                            TimeUnit unit)
                     throws InterruptedException
        Block the calling thread for the specified time, waiting for the completion of this Promise.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout value
        unit - the TimeUnit of the timeout value
        Returns:
        true if complete without error completed
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interruped while awaiting completion

      • await

        public O await()
        throws InterruptedException
        Block the calling thread, waiting for the completion of this Promise. A default timeout as specified in Reactor's Environment properties using the key reactor.await.defaultTimeout is used. The default is 30 seconds. If the promise is completed with an error a RuntimeException that wraps the error is thrown.
        Returns:
        the value of this Promise or null if the timeout is reached and the Promise has not completed
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interruped while awaiting completion
        RuntimeException - if the promise is completed with an error

      • poll

        public O poll()
        Block the calling thread, waiting for the completion of this Promise. A default timeout as specified in Reactor's Environment properties using the key reactor.await.defaultTimeout is used. The default is 30 seconds. If the promise is completed with an error a RuntimeException that wraps the error is thrown.
        Returns:
        the value of this Promise or null if the timeout is reached and the Promise has not completed
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the promise is completed with an error

      • poll

        public O poll(long timeout,
              TimeUnit unit)
        Block the calling thread for the specified time, waiting for the completion of this Promise. If the promise is completed with an error a RuntimeException that wraps the error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout value
        unit - the TimeUnit of the timeout value
        Returns:
        the value of this Promise or null if the timeout is reached and the Promise has not completed

        public O get()
